alert.note: Alert for Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County; Laramie Valley; North Snowy Range Foothills; Sierra Madre Range; Snowy Range; South Laramie Range; Upper North Platte River Basin (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 04 at 5:11PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Carbon and southwestern Albany Counties through 545 PM MDT... At 511 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Arlington to Boswell Creek Campground. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Albany, Rock River, Elk Mountain, Bosler, Six Mile Campground, Brooklyn Lake Campground, Woods Landing-Jelm, Nash Fork Campground, Ryan Park Campground, Boswell Creek Campground, Rob Roy Reservoir, Lake Owen, Bobbie Thompson Campground, Hutton Lake, Arlington, French Creek Campground, Brooklyn Lake, Sugar Loaf Campground, Libby Creek Campground and Bow River Campground. This includes Interstate 80 in Wyoming between mile markers 254 and 306. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
